thread.title: Kunal Ganjawala: I don’t like my own songs
thread.title_full: Kunal Ganjawala: I don’t like my own songs - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Kunal Ganjawala: I don’t like my own songs
text:
The singer tells us why he would rather listen to an RD Burman song than his own, and why he wishes to shoot a music video at the Taj Mahal.
READ: ​ We don't really need to go across the border & get mediocre talent: Kunal Ganjawala
Kunal Ganjawala, the voice behind romantic tracks like ' O humdum soniye re' and ' Bheege honth tere ,' says he is not an admirer of his songs. However, he is a romantic at heart and shares with us his love for the Taj Mahal and how he wishes to pay a tribute to the monument's beauty with one of his songs.
Listen to songs of Kunal Ganjawala on Gaana.com
I don't like my songs
He says, "I don't particularly like my songs. I don't listen to them after recording. I let the audience decide. But I love listening to all the legends we have had in our music industry as each of them was ahead of their time. It's not like they composed music that ended with their time. It's still very relevant... it's timeless. RD Burman is my all-time favourite, but I can't decide which song of his I like the most. It would be like deciding which boss you like the most among your many bosses."
I want to make a music video with the Taj Mahal in the backdrop
Many Bollywood songs have been shot at the Taj Mahal and Kunal too plans to do something similar. He says, "I would love to shoot a song with the Taj Mahal in the backdrop, but I will do that only when I have a song worthy of it. I don't want to do it for the heck of it. I want my song to do justice to the beauty of the monument and so, it has to be something special. I want to express my unconditional love for the Taj." The singer says he is excited about turning music composer. "I am composing music for a couple of films and I am excited about switching to music direction. I am also working on a couple of singles."
U.P. mein perform karne ki ek alag feel hai
Kunal has performed in many cities across the country but he thinks that his concerts in UP cities stand out. He says, "I have had a few shows in UP and the audience here is great. UP mein perform karne ki ek alag feel hai jaise kisi performance ko tadka lagaya ho ." Talking about his visits to the state, he says, "I am very vocal about things I feel. I was recently passing through the Yamuna Expressway (Noida to Agra) and I realized how beautiful it is. I have obviously crossed it more than ten times, but this time, the whole experience felt different. I felt a sense of belonging to UP. There is so much to see and explore here."
